bio: Maya Angelou was an American poet, novelist, memoirist, and civil rights activist. She was born in St. Louis, Missouri, in 1928, and died in New York City in 2014. Maya Angelou is best known for her autobiographical works, including I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings, and her poetry collections of the same name and I Know a Lot About Angelou.
